name: UNA Hotel Cusani

reviews.text: I stayed here for a weekend at the start of my trip. The check-in was friendly and efficient and I was very pleased with my room. It was clean, spacious and well furnished with a modern esthetic that I like. The bathroom was large and the bathroom amenities were plentiful. The only negative I would say is the bed was super hard! I still slept well and I know a lot of people like a hard bed, but this was beyond any other bed I've ever experienced.
reviews.title: a great hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really appreciated the central location which was close to the Duomo and a pedestrian-only area. I had no problem navigating to major sights in the area on foot.
reviews.title: Good Hotel! Fabulous location!

reviews.text: The breakfast catered to a lot of dietary needs. There were hot eggs and meats along with plenty of fruit and bread and juices.

reviews.text: We stayed at the Una Cusani in May. The hotel was located minutes from the Cadorna train station. Since we had planned to spend a lot of time in the northern Lake district, this hotel served as a great jumping off point - because most trains going north start off from the Cadorna station.
reviews.title: Beware: Two classes of Rooms

likes.liked: — location - far from train station, and close to Magenta area which is really nice
likes.disliked: — The seedy room was quite seedy indeed! Hammock style bed and filthy...kind of scary, in fact.

reviews.title: centrally located hotel
reviews.text: We booked a suite to accommodate 2 adults and 2 children for 3 days. The suite was on the third floor at the end of the corridor and unlike others, while you could hear the trams it was an interesting city sound....a part of staying in Milan...
The rooms themselves were very dated and dark...you needed the lights all the time and even then the level of lighting was poor.
reviews.title: Amazing location, excellent service

reviews.text: I think I nearly lost my daughted in the couch....she sunk down so low and the furniture was torn and definately in need of updating. It's bad when you have to pull a sixteen year old out of a chair!
reviews.title: Una Cusani - great place, great location

reviews.text: The rooms were clean and there were ample towels in the bathroom.
reviews.title: Excellent location, but choose a room away from the tram noise

reviews.text: Our biggest gripe was the TV.....you could get CNN without the sound...when I asked why...I was told there was a techincal problem!!!!!!!!!!! The children were happy with Cartoon Network in english....but the pay tv movie channel (€12 a day) only played the same movie all day each day...we did watch it one night! It would have been nice to have a choice of movies.
reviews.title: Love Marco!!!
Fantastic Value!
reviews.text: 199 Euro per night. Renovated room quality compares well to the Bulgari Hotel. Awesome!!!

This UNA has just finished redecorating 5th and 3d floors. It's very, very nice: I would have guessed the price to be at least triple of the rack rate I paid. I had room 302. It'd be a junior suite anywhere else. I still can't believe what a sweet deal this is. Location is great, of course, BUT WHEN COMPARED TO WHAT ELSE 199 EUROS BUYS YOU IN THIS TOWN... don't even think of going anywhere else! (I felt that it was a good deal even before they gave me a remodeled room).
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our family could not have been more pleased with our stay at the Una Cusani. From the moment we checked in until we checked out the staff was most pleasant and helpful. When I mentioned that we would be leaving before breakfast, the clerk offered to pack us a complimentary breakfast. The bedding was wonderful (600 count sheets)and the beds were comfortable, The room was decorated very nicely and there was no street noise. The room and bathroom were exceptionally clean. The public rooms were also very attractive. The location was excellent for viewing the sights in Milan as all the major attractions were in walking distance, I would highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: excellent italian modern hotel

reviews.text: Stayed at the Cusani January, 2007 and was very satisfied with the facility. Breakfast which offered many choices including hot food and plenty of fresh fruit was served in a well lit and inviting dining room (unlike some hotels which send you into the basement). In the morning complimentary English newspapers are available outside the breakfast area. In the evening, you can get cappucinos or drinks in the comfortable lobby area where you can find complimentary snacks. The staff was helpful and knowledgeable and offered assistance which I found comparable to higher end hotels. I went as a single and stayed in a very confortable room with an up to date spacious (for Europe) and well lit bathroom which had a full size stall shower, heated towel rack, makeup mirror. I noted that the towels are not terrific and they did not provide washcloths. The room was very clean and I found the bed and bedding fresh and comfortable. I should note that the bed is firm which is to my taste. Since I am a shopper I loved the location which was about 5 blocks from MonteNapoleone and the fashion district. You can also walk to the Duomo and La Scala but that is a bit more of a hike. All in all I was very happy with this choice and would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: good choice

likes.liked: — clean and confortable with full hotel amenities at reasonable price

reviews.text: Just returned from a 4 night trade show visit to Milan (old fairgrounds) and wanted to share some info about the Una Hotel Cusani. I previously stayed in this general area of Milan and wanted the convenience of being within a few minutes walk of the Malpensa Express, Brera district, and the Duomo area. This hotel fit the bill perfectly.
reviews.title: Excellent Value

reviews.text: The lobby is clean and classy with a small bar and wireless internet access (you must purchase time, even when using your own laptop and there is no access from the rooms). Breakfast was good; scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, breads, cereals, fruits, yogurts, etc. One night I ate dinner in the hotel and it was excellent.
reviews.title: Excellent location, excellent hotel

reviews.text: The rooms have plenty of closet space, a decent size bathroom (there is a large step down from the bathtub to the floor so those who may have trouble with that should be aware), plenty of light, and a decent bed. Nothing overly fancy but better than most European hotels of this level.
reviews.title: UNA-THE ONE AND ONLY !!!!!!!!!!!FABULOUS HOTEL
Superb Hotel
reviews.text: The only negative thing I could say about this hotel was the noise level. The trolley cars passing by make PLENTY of noise and sometimes make the room shake. Also there is a good amount of street noise from cars and from people passing by late at night. None of that noise kept me from sleeping but if you are a light sleeper you need to be aware of this.

description: The elegant UNA Hotel Cusani lies in a very central position between the Castello Sforzesco and the Duomo. Its 92 refined rooms and the welcoming lounges of the hall provide exclusive comfort. The hotel features 6 meeting rooms equipped with the ultimate technologies accommodating up to 90 delegates. The well-known restaurant offers a taste of the best gastronomic specialties of traditional and international cuisines. Private garage is available for customers.
